column4: hi I can't remove mysql-server with apt-get. It actually tries to install mysql-server when I do it and I get error messages: http://pastebin.com/LJMQvC4B
it's not installed but it seems you tried to install it but it failed
ok sec
loads of errors. something is really messed up.
the error appears to be in the text you posted.
Fatal error: Can't change to run as user 'mysql' ;  Please check that the user  exists!
from where is the source for that package you are installing? is it ubuntu standard repos?
note: I'm trying to completly remove mysql
yes
i know
but it failed to install initially it is 'queued'
I see
if you observe the message it says "mysql not installed so not removing" then it goes on to process the stuff it couldn't before
can you do this dpkg -l '*mysql*'
http://pastebin.com/UikYQkMt

2 hours ago mysql was acting weird, couldnt grant priv. to a newly created user. So after a while i decided to reinstall mysql. And then apt-get remove went bonkers, i tried manually removing some directories and the mysql user, now it is royally messed up.
so uninstall mysql-server-5.5
looks clean now
right - there are post and pre scripts that execute when packages are installed - doing steps manually before asking the apt system or others will generally mess up stuff - not badly but yea
cool
thx!
sure
